title: Video & MPFree: Love Among The Mannequins – Alfred Garyevich Schnittke
content:
You gotta love those hardworking chaps at Function Records. They’ve already released material from the wondrously various likes of Juffage, ✝Hymns✝ and Shield Your Eyes this year, but far from resting on their laurels, they’re throwing more and more of the good stuff at us. Working up to the release of debut full-length Radial Images on Function, Brighton-based Love Among The Mannequins (featuring them out of O You Broken Eyes, Shoes and Socks Off and Crooked Mountain Crooked Sea) have created the archive footage-based video for Alfred Garyevich Schnittke, as well as putting the song up for download.

As is probably par for the course for a band named after a line penned by J.G. Ballard, Schnittke manages to cram an impressive amount of references to the cultural greats of the last few centuries into its three and a quarter minutes. It can be snooty, silly, or ferociously forward-thinking, depending on which way you look at it, but whatever you decide, Alfred Garyevich Schnittke is a whole heckload of juddering, distorted, Pavement-flavoured fun. Can you think of another guitar band who can make the words ‘Beethoven’s Burton’s line’ sound so motherfuckin’ catchy? Nah. Didn’t think so.

Radial Images is out Monday 17th November on Function Records. To download Alfred Garyevich Schnittke head over to the Function bandcamp. You can keep track of Love Among via their Tumblr.
